issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Support meta tag element in Hadoop XML configurations

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A new feature of the product, which has yet to be developed.
issuetype.name: New Feature

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description: For tagging related properties together use resource name as source. Currently it assumes source is configured in xml itself.
fields.summary: Get source for config tags from file name

+1, There is one checkStyle issue, I could fix that while committing. However, the tests don't seem to check that the property is in the expected source file. Can you add that assertion to this test, please? You can file a follow up JIRA for this issue. I can see we have other tests that check for source.

I am going to wait for your comment to go ahead and commit this, that is if you would like to modify this JIRA or file another one if test modification is needed.
[~anu], thanks for review. Updated test case to check for source file as well.
[~ajayydv] Thanks for updating the patch. +1, pending jenkins.

[~ajayydv] Can you please look at the ASF licence warning, is our tests generating a core-site or something? v3 patch tests seem to have a failure with ASF license  and it points to 
{{/testptch/hadoop/hadoop-common-project/hadoop-common/core-site.xml}}, but patch v2 did not have that failure. Not committing till we get a chance to check.
[~anu], this is a temporary file used in test case. Added cleanup for it in {{TestConfiguration#tearDown}} in patch v4.
